programme.title: FOR THE CAUSE
programme.desc: Mirai Scott, a civil rights attorney in Chicago, defends her estranged father, a former Black Panther, against a 30-year-old attempted murder charge. Long-held hostilities and accusations explode as Mirai aggressively pursues her fatherâ€™s defense.

programme.title: Journey of Lion
programme.desc: Brother Howie is a Jamaican Rastafari who dreams of the land of his ancestors: Africa. On a journey in search of his roots and his identity he travels through three continents and (with great humor and sensitivity) discovers the world and Africa.

programme.title: LITTLE MUSIC MANCHILD: THE STORY OF MALIK KOFI
programme.desc: The story follows an 11-year old African American Birmingham native, child prodigy who plays the cello.

programme.title: 77 DAYS
programme.desc: Addiction takes a toll on everyone. A young mother returns home from another stint at rehab estranged from her siblings and son

programme.title: THE BILL
programme.desc: Lena and ten other women could not be more excited to celebrate Barbie's 35th birthday. When an unexpectedly huge bill arrives, the happy birthday dissolves into drama.

programme.title: BROTHERS HYPNOTIC
programme.desc: For the eight young men in the Hypnotic Brass Ensemble, 'brotherhood' is literal: they're all sons of anti-establishment jazz legend, Phil Cohran.

programme.title: COMPANY TOWN
programme.desc: One man goes up against one of the nation's largest paper mill and chemical plants, owned by billionaire brothers Charles Koch and David Koch of Koch Industries, in a bid to save his town from sickness-causing pollution.

programme.title: BURKINABE RISING
programme.desc: BurkinabĂ¨ Rising showcases creative nonviolent resistance in Burkina Faso. A small, landlocked country in West Africa, Burkina Faso is home to a vibrant community of artists and engaged citizens, who provide an example of the type of political change that can be achieved when people come together.

programme.title: THE LONG ROAD TO HALL OF FAME
programme.desc: The Long Road To The Hall Of Fame is a feature length documentary about Malik Farrakhan, his life is a parable spanning the last 40 years of African-American history.

programme.title: WAVES S1 EP1
programme.desc: Nia and her sister Jean have an estranged relationship after Jean becomes close with alcohol and partying, around the same time Nia was going through a break up with her fiancĂ©. Jean now returns a year later hoping to mend the relationship with her sister. However, she has a secret that will rip their relationship apart for good.

programme.desc: Nia and her sister Jean have an estranged relationship after Jean becomes close with alcohol and partying, around the same time Nia was going through a break up with her fiancĂ©. programme.title: BE A FISH
programme.desc: Determined, 9 year-old Taylor buys a fish in order to practice how to swim for her â€śBig Day.â€ť

programme.title: DARATT
programme.desc: When the government announces an amnesty for all war criminals, 16-year-old Atim's grandfather gives him a revolver and tells him to find his father's killer. The teenager loses no time in tracking him down.

programme.title: Gonzo Episode 1
programme.desc: A drama that follows the struggles of black college students and their efforts to make reform on their university campus. But once there is a clash in ideology between the schoolâ€™s Black Student Organization and Gonzo, Gonzo is pressured to step up, take charge, and be the voice of the schoolâ€™s black student body.

programme.desc: A drama that follows the struggles of black college students and their efforts to make reform on their university campus. programme.title: FIRST DATE
programme.desc: A former, female boxing champion and her business partner coach are mentoring two teenage girls, best friends through their non-profit gym.

programme.title: La Source
programme.desc: Narrated by Oscar-nominated actor Don Cheadle (Hotel Rwanda, Crash), La Source tells the uplifting story of Josue Lajuenesse, a Haitian Princeton janitor who returns to his country after the devastating 2010 earthquake to revive his lifelong dream to bring what is most fundamental to his village's survival; clean water.

programme.title: BLACK MUSEUM
programme.desc: Through interviews and observation, Director Oliver Hardt, who frequently addresses black history and culture with a strong emphasis on architecture, takes us through the remarkable physical spaces, the palpable engagement of museum visitors, and gives us insight into the challenges faced during the design process. The success of the project serves as a reminder that design and advanced storytelling can challenge the dominant political discourse and enable a diverse conversation.
